block_comment: This block of code implements a timeout function on a digital system. It always monitors the rising edge of a system clock and checks if a predetermined timeout counter (`timeout`) is not zero. If the timeout counter reaches or exceeds the specified timeout value, it takes certain action. In the absence of the defined 'NETLIST', it triggers an error message. Also, independent of this 'NETLIST' it displays a "Timeout Error" message suggesting the user to edit the timeouts.txt in $AMBER_BASE/hw/tests to change the timeout.
